comments:
Build: Callisto 3.2 RC1

1) Created a new workspace "out of the box" with all Callisto plugins installed.
2) Created a simple Java project, and added the following class:


3) Run > Profile As > Java Application
4) Select "Execution Time Analysis" 

An error dialog opens saying "One of the selected launch delegates has failed".  Reason:

java.lang.NullPointerException
  at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.AbstractProcessLauncher.configureProcess(AbstractProcessLauncher.java:179)
  at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.internal.launcher.deleg.application.PIJavaLauncherDelegate.configureProcess(PIJavaLauncherDelegate.java:48)
  at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.run(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:302)
  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:813)
Did you try to run this using a standalone Agent Controller or the integrated version of the Agent Controller?
I ran completely with out of the box default settings.  I don't know what an "agent controller" is, so whatever runs by default is what I was using.

This error is caused because of the client code not being able to establish a connection with the Integrated Agent Controller (IAC).  I am printing a more meaningful message instead of the NPE stack trace.

It's very likely that you have run into the following problem:  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=135613 which was fixed yesterday.  The workaround to the problem is to remove your /tmp/IBMRAC directory (this will not be required after our driver picks up the fix from 135613).

If you can still reproduce the problem, then please open a defect against the following component: Platform.Execution.Framework and prefix the summary with [IAC].
